result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon G Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Room w/in Building, etc., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(f).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

No contact with J.K.
No contact with Belgium Foundry.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.  
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Pay supervision fees.
Defendant eligible for Earned Release Program on or after 10/1/2018.
Submit DNA sample before leaving Ozaukee County Jail.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be collected during term of supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Proposed Order Granting Motion to Withdraw. Scanned/Forwarded to Branch 2 clerk.

Defendant Brandon G Erickson by video from Red Granite Correctional with attorney Donna Odrzywolski.  Shannon M Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received notice to withdraw from attorney Odrzywoldki and would like to proceed pro se rather than having attorney Odrzywolski file a No Merit on his behalf. Attorney Odrzywolski states that if defendant waives his right to an attorney today, another public defender will not be appointed. Court examines defendant on proceeding pro se. Counsel advises defendant she has requested an extention to file post conviction motions.  Attorney Odrzywolski will forward the file to the defendant after she has received an answer on her request. Court grants motion. Defendant has sixty days from date order filed by attorney Odrzywolski to have papers on file with Court of Appeals.
Clerk arranged video conferencing with Red Granite Correctional Institution
Motion hearing on June 13, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

8:56am Defendant Brandon G Erickson in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Request for sequestration. Granted. Preliminary matters addressed by court and counsel before jury is brought into courtroom. 9:05am Jury panel brought into courtroom. Oath to jurors. Voir dire by court. 9:18am Voir dire by ADA Sisley. 9:37am Voir dire by Attorney Magana. Striking of jury panel. 9:46am Jury panel sworn, remaining jurors thanked and excused. Preliminary instructions read to the jury. 9:54am Opening statement by ADA Sisley.  10:08am Opening statement by Attorney Magana. 10:10am Jury excused. Recess. 10:32am In session, appearances same. Sequestration of witness'. Jury returns to courtroom. State calls JK sworn & testified. 10:54am Cross exam. 11:01am Redirect. 11:03am Recross. 11:04am Witness excused. Playing of video. 11:45am State calls TE sworn & testified. 11:51am Cross exam. 11:57am Jury excused from courtroom. 12:00pm Recess for lunch. 1:20pm In session, appearances same. Jury returns to courtroom. State calls MLM sworn & testified. No cross. State calls Deputy Patrick Frame sworn & testified.  1:36pm Cross exam.  1:40pm Redirect. 1:41pm State rests. Jury excused from courtroom. Attorney Magana makes oral motion to dismiss. Denied. 1:54pm Jury returns to courtroom. Defense calls Brandon Erickson sworn & testified. 2:02pm Cross exam. 2:41pm Redirect. 2:43pm Recross. 2:44pm Jury excused from courtroom. Jury instruction conference. Recess. Recalled, appearances same.  3:30pm Jury returns to courtroom. Court reads jury instructions. 3:47pm Closing argument by ADA Sisley. 4:01pm Closing argument by Attorney Magana. 4:09pm Rebuttal by ADA Sisley. 4:12pm Final instructions to the jury. 4:17pm Bailiff sworn. Jury excused to deliberate. 7:25pm In session, appearances same, jury returns to courtroom. Jury foreperson JK. Jury finds:
count 1: guilty
count 2: guilty
count 3: guilty
Jury polled as to verdicts. Jury thanked and excused. State moves for judgment on the verdicts. Granted. PSI requested by the State. Bail revoked.

Defendant Brandon G Erickson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Buckett believed matter was going to be a disposition today but Mr Erickson is now requesting to have new counsel. Defendant requests new speedy trial demand and new counsel. Defendant Brandon G Erickson in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy P. Frame, sworn & testified. Cross exam. State rests. No witness' for the defense.  State moves for bind over. Defense objects. Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. Information filed.   Information read, defendant advised of penalties, further reading waived. Plea of not guilty entered. Motion on bail addressed by Atty Buckett. State opposes request. Court reduces bail to $4500 cash.  Speedy trial demand requested.  Further proceedings scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.
